Blogging with jekyll 101

Getting this adventure off the ground

September 24, 2014

Letâ€™s get started this blogging thing with a bit of inside on how to get started with Jekyll and host it for free with github pages. It took me a while to figure out the whole process and I actually had to use Cloudflare to get over a 302 error.

Jekyll

Jekyll is a static site generator widely used amongst developer, designer or anybody just wiling to write from a simple editor like Sublime or Atom. Jekyll uses Markdown syntax to format the post into HTML. It is pretty lightweight, easy to use but the best thing about Jekyll is that it can be hosted on Github for free. Jekyll has a very comprehensive documentation to get you started in no time. To start exploring how Jekyll works just run the following commands. The easiest way to get you started is to fork an existing repo.

Here are my top 10 jekyll themes/repos:

  • Jekyll incorporated
  • Hyde
  • Poole
  • Pixyll
  • Clean Blog
  • Shiori
  • Jekyll clean
  • Cahoon
  • Jekyll now
  • Jekyll Material Design

This blog is based on Clean Blog with a simple side-bar
